concept.title: Encrypted data access
concept.abstract: The Couchbase Server client libraries support client-side encryption using the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol. Enterprise Edition only.To enable SSL on the client-side, you need to get an SSL certificate from Couchbase Server and then follow the steps specific to the client you are using.

conbody.p: To obtain the Couchbase Server SSL certificate, access the Couchbase Server web console, navigate to Settings > Certificate > show certificate >, and copy the certificate.
conbody.note: If the Couchbase Server SSL certificate is regenerated, you will need to obtain the new certificate.
The Couchbase network port, 11207, is used for data communication between the client and the data nodes using SSL.
